title: Drawing, "Design  for a Painted Ceiling: Triumph of Meekness and Strength", ca. 1780
medium: Brush and chinese black wash, pen and ink, black chalk on paper
provenance: From the collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Seated upon clouds are a woman beside a lamb and an armoured woman holding a column.  An angel holding the tiara flies over them, another one shouldering the keys at left, a genius blowing the trumpet, at right.  Four animals are shown at the foot of the group: a seal, a unicorn, an eagle with a doble head (referring to Austria or Russia), a lion crouching on a fork (England).   Written on top, in pencil: "Trionfo della Mansuetudine e della Fortezza."  [Triumph of Gentleness and Strength]

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design  for a Painted Ceiling: Triumph of Meekness and Strength", ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Brush and chinese black wash, pen and ink, black chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3313.
